page.title: 20Local Speech-Castle Kennedy
page.content: On informal occasions most of the people in this area speak a form of Lowland Scots described as Galloway Irish.Many families speak this all the time and some children start school without any experience of Standard English apart from television.Examples -Hae ye seen ma mither an fether? A'm gaun tae the toon on Seturday.Counting -Yin,twa..fower..sax..seeven..echt.. eleeven..twunty..hunner. Usual Scots words e.g.lum(chimney),lug(ear),oxter (armpit). Also local words mostly associated with the country e.g heuck(sickle) grannie moolie(brown hairy caterpillar) craa taes (wild hyacinth). Expressions:-Hey boi (hey you(male). Wha was she tae her ain name? (What was her maiden name? This Castle Kennedy entry was written and compiled by Classes 5,6,7. Castle Kennedy School,Wigtonshire,Scotland.
